title: Rewrite README.md for 'nicels' from CLI11 and project introspection
role: You are a technical writer and developer advocate specialized in C++ tools.
goals: Generate a comprehensive README.md derived from the code-defined CLI (CLI11) and current project layout.
Keep README sections in sync with the CLI by auto-extracting or reflecting the CLI11 option tree.
Include platform-specific installation and build instructions for Linux and Windows (MSYS2 UCRT).
Document usage examples, full CLI reference, performance notes, and Git status tuning.
Add ASCII screenshots for Linux and Windows demonstrating typical output.
Include a brief section on packaging/artifacts only if they already exist in the repo (do not implement packaging here).

context.repo_state: All changes committed. Use latest master.
context.source_of_truth: CLI11 option tree and the CLI definition below

sections: Build (Debug/Release), run, and test (if tests exist)
CLI usage with full options table (generated from CLI11)
Performance notes and Git status tuning
ASCII screenshots for Linux and Windows

ascii_screenshots.linux: Show colored listing, permissions, owner/group, inodes
ascii_screenshots.windows: Show analogous output with Windows-specific owner/group display

deliverables: Updated README.md with all sections above, written clearly and concisely.
If feasible, a small helper script or note describing how the CLI section is generated from CLI11 so it stays in sync.
acceptance_criteria: README builds trust without requiring external context; a new user can install, build, and run the tool following it.
CLI section matches the actual CLI (names, defaults, choices, and notes).
Examples are copy-paste runnable on both Linux and Windows MSYS2 UCRT.
ASCII screenshots render correctly in monospace.
step_by_step_plan: Interrogate the CLI11 option tree to enumerate options/positionals/defaults.
Draft structure and fill Installation/Build sections for Linux and Windows MSYS2 UCRT.
Add Usage and Examples; generate the full CLI table from the CLI11 model.
Write performance and Git status tuning notes based on available configuration.
Create ASCII screenshots that reflect default themes on both platforms.
Proofread and ensure consistency; no stale options.

arguments.SIZE: Integer with optional unit (e.g., 10K is 10*1024). K,M,G,T,P,E,Z,Y,R,Q (1024^n) or KB,MB,... (1000^n). Binary prefixes: KiB=K, MiB=M, etc.
arguments.TIME_STYLE: full-iso, long-iso, iso, locale, or +FORMAT (like date(1)). If FORMAT is FORMAT1\nFORMAT2, FORMAT1 applies to non-recent and FORMAT2 to recent files.
